## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been looking into Verus DeFi and I was wondering, what are the benefits of Verus DeFi compared to EVM-like account-based systems?

**AI Assistant:**
Verus DeFi has several advantages. It is fair, cheap, and has no rent-seekers. It is also MEV-free, meaning it is resistant to front-running, back-running, and sandwich attacks. Additionally, it does not have the problems associated with EVM-like account-based systems. This makes Verus DeFi a more secure and equitable option for decentralized finance.

**User:**
That sounds great. I've also been wondering about centralized currencies in Verus. What are the benefits of a centralized version of a currency in Verus, and how does it relate to the rootID?

**AI Assistant:**
When a centralized version of a currency is created in Verus, the owner of the rootID can mint currencies into existence, automatically lowering the reserve ratio, or burn currencies, automatically raising the reserve ratio. This allows for more control over the currency and its reserve ratio. The rootID is essentially the master ID that has control over the currency, and this control is what enables the owner to make these changes to the reserve ratio. This level of control can be beneficial for certain use cases, such as stablecoins or other centralized currencies.
What are the benefits of Verus DeFi compared to EVM-like account-based systems?

Verus DeFi is fair, cheap, and has no rent-seekers. It is MEV-free, meaning it is resistant to front-running, back-running, and sandwich attacks. Additionally, it does not have the problems associated with EVM-like account-based systems.

When a centralized version of this currency is created, the owner of the rootID can mint currencies into existence, while automatically lowering the reserve ratio. Or they can burn currencies and automatically raise the reserve ratio. Anyone can also just burn the currency at will without raising the reserve ratio.The conversion fees are incredibly low, 0.025% when converting to and from a basket currency, and 0.05% when converting from reserve to reserve currency. These fees go directly to the worldwide miners and stakers of the protocol, and/or they are accrued into the reserves making the basket currency worth more.| Conversion type | Fee | Fee goes to |
| :-----| :------ | :-------- |
| Basket currency ↔️ reserve | 0.025% | 0.0125% added to reserves of the basket currency, 0.0125% to the block reward for miners and stakers | 
| Reserve ↔️ reserve | 0.05% | 0.025% added to reserves of the basket currency, 0.025% to the block reward for miners and stakers |Because all currency conversions are solved simultaneously inside a block, giving all participants the same price, the protocol is MEV-free (no front-running, back-running, sandwich attacks etc.). The protocol doesn’t have any of the problems EVM-like account-based systems have. Verus DeFi is fair, cheap and has no rent-seekers.Every(!) currency and token on the Verus network (also mapped ERC-20s!), can be used as reserves for basket currencies. As you might start to understand now — basket currencies are unique currencies that can not be found anywhere else and offer an enormous amount of opportunities for value creation.
